summary: The build request explicitly requires NO code changes — only a clean rebuild and redeploy of the existing codebase. However, the diff shows two modified files: backend/main.mo and project_state.json. Even though the content shown appears to be the existing backend code, the fact that these files are listed as 'Modified' in the diff technically violates the core constraint of REQ-141, which states no source files may be modified. The diff does not provide evidence of actual deployment artifacts (compiled Wasm, bundled frontend assets, deployment logs), making it impossible to verify that all acceptance criteria were actually met.

missing_requirements.requirement: No source files are modified — only a clean rebuild and redeploy is performed
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows backend/main.mo and project_state.json as 'Modified' files, which directly violates the constraint that no code changes of any kind may be made to any file.
No frontend build artifacts, route registration files, or deployment evidence are present in the diff to confirm that all required routes are correctly bundled and served.
